name: yogurt production, from cow milk | cream, from cow milk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11944/documentation

This dataset represents the production of yogurt made from cow milk in Quebec (Canada). The product is an aggregation of various types of yogurt (standard, greek yogurt, yogurt to drink) and various fat content and flavourings (fruits, aroma). An average of data from three producers in the region of Quebec has been made. ;The packaging in which the yogurt is sold is not included. Here are some information on an average composition (for 1 kg of yogurt) of the packaginig used by the sites covered by the data collection process : ;- low-density polyethylene : 3,577E-03 kg;- paper : 4,541E-03 kg;- aluminium paper : 1,295E-03 kg;- paperboard : 7,281E-02 kg;- polyethylene : 9,522E-03 kg;- polystyrene : 2,166E-02 kg;- expanded polystyrene : 1,997E-02 kg;- polypropylene : 1,520E-02 kg; 

From reception of milk and other inputs at the factory gate. 

This activity ends with yogurt at factory gate. 
The dataset includes yogurt production, refrigeration (energy and losses) on site, energy for primary and secondary packaging and infrastruture for the plant. 
The dataset doesn't include packaging materials.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/105:Manufacture of dairy products/1050:Manufacture of dairy products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Collected data for Quebec industry for the years 2010-2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from three producers located on four sites in the region of Québec.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Concentrated milk et milk powder used as ingredients for yogurt production are approximated with the addition of milk equivalent to the milk input and with the two operations "evaporation of milk" and "spray-drying of milk". 
Wastewater from factories with almost no information on composition (only data is an average COD = 2.5 kg/m³) has been approximated with wastewater from potato starch production (COD = 2 kg/m³).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Measured values for inputs and outputs based on data survey from three yogurt producers (total of 4 production sites) in Québec.
The inventory is estimated to be representative of over 75% of overall Quebec production

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value (in kg of Fat and Protein Corrected Milk). This flow represents the input of cow milk. 
FPCM is 4.0% fat and 3.3% true protein content. Conversion to FPCM is as follow, according to the International Dairy Federation: FPCM (kg/yr) = Production (kg/yr) x [0.1226 x Fat% + 0.0776 x Protein% + 0.2534]

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value (in kg of Fat and Protein Corrected Milk). This flow represents the input of concentrated milk and milk powder used at plant. Concentrated milk and milk powder are expressed in cow milk equivalent and their production is approximated with the "evaporation of milk" and "spary-drying of milk" flows. Milk for concentrated milk and milk powder do not necessary come from Quebec milk market (so no activity link to the Quebec milk dataset is made). 
 FPCM is 4.0% fat and 3.3% true protein content. Conversion to FPCM is as follow, according to the International Dairy Federation: FPCM (kg/yr) = Production (kg/yr) x [0.1226 x Fat% + 0.0776 x Protein% + 0.2534]

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Transport of cow milk is added because of the activity link used to link the "cow milk" exchange to the "milk production, Quebec" dataset. If a market is used instead of the activity link, the transport should be transfered to the market dataset and be removed from this dataset. 
The distance of 100 km is the average distance between milk farmers and milk transformation plants in Quebec (Source : Quantis, CIRAIG and AGECO (2012). Environmental and Socioeconomic Life Cycle Assessment of Canadian Milk. Report for Dairy Farmers of Canada).
